div.p: W70/12875, unit 674, VPRS 3991/P inward registered correspondence VA 475 Chief Secretary's Department, Public Record Office, Victoria.

Trans. Angela. To proof.
See also M to J. O'Shanassy, 29 April 1863. Melbourne bot. Garden

I have the honor to transmit for the inspection of the hon. the Chief Secretary a proofcopy of the 5th volume on the plants of Australia, issued very recently by the President of the Linean Society under my sole aid. My reason for sending this copy for Sir James McCullochs inspection is surely to show to the honorable Gentleman, what the result has been of part of my labors in 1869. I beg to avail myself of this opportunity to point respectfully out, that in submitting my estimate for the botanic Gardens Department for 1871, I omitted to make provision for the continuance of this work and entertain a hope, that the honorable the Chief Secretary will augment the sum for publishing plants (in former years £320) by one hundred pounds, that being the ruin promised to Mr Beutham for each volume as a subsidy of hte Victorian Government, as that amount will be due in 1871 for the 6th volume.

div.p:
Undersecretary
On 6 October 1870 the Chief Secretary, J. McCulloch, asked Mueller to 'give me particulars of the arrangement [..] with Mr Bentham'. Mueller replied on 7 October, 'In the year 1861 Mr Bentham [cart as on last p. of file to] the Department.' McCulloch responded: 'I do not see any engagement on the part of the Colony [..] [...] [...] get me a copy of the [work] to look at.'
On 24April 1873 the Crown Land's office wrote to the Chief Secretary's office: 'For Correspondence re publication in England of Baron von Mueller's description of Australian Botany'. The correspondence was forwarded to the Crown Land's office, 30 April and returned to the Chief Secretary's office, 6 March 1874.
